nodes.bodyText: I used the same comment (almost) as in the ViewServiceConfig. Happy to change it if important but I thought it made sense anyway
I suggested in #3662 that we could have a type of the view service - that we could interrogate rather than using reflection.
Perhaps - but it's another thing that the user has to set - I think I prefer it with just the class in the JSON

I would not expect the user to set it - we use the name of the view service to get the registration details -where I would expect this flag to reside, most of the registration document does not need to sent in .
this line and next line could be moved out of the ifs -as these fields exist in ViewServiceConfig. They can be removed from the integration service code as well.
Do you mean the omagServerName ad omagServerPlatformRootURL? They are only relevant on Solution and Vanilla configs; they are bot used at all in an Integration view service
I suggest we fail the request if we do not recognise the view service as one of the 2 types we support
I thought we only support the integration type and the governance solution one, I am suggesting if it is not one of them we should fail the request as it is meaningless.
why do we need to delete these lines - they should work where they are; unless I am missing something
As above - they are not used on an Integration view service
